column1: The Pit Room////Not sure how this place has so many stars. My husband and I ate there and I ordered a sliced brisket sandwich. The brisket was tough
column2: mostly fat and not very flavorful. The sauce was thick and vinegary and the potato salad did not contain many potato chunks. It was 90% mayonnaise/mustard sauce. My husband's chopped brisket sandwich was pre-chopped and dry. If our food was typical of this restaurant
column3: they will not last long in a city accustomed to superb barbeque. We will not be going back to The Pit Room.
